pattern: Shell Subscriber for Redis Pub/Sub Commands
example: Deployed as LaunchAgent with KeepAlive: true and ThrottleInterval: 30s. Successfully processing test messages (visible in logs). Pattern: Subscribe → Parse JSON → Execute → Publish result. Critical for multi-agent command chains.

Files: redis_chain_status.zsh (main tool), redis_status.zsh (quick viewer), com.02luka.redis_chain_status.plist (LaunchAgent). Reports saved to ~/02luka/g/reports/redis_chain/latest.txt. Provides visibility into Redis infrastructure health.

Fixed com.02luka.gg.nlp-bridge by changing KeepAlive from false to true. After reload, gg:nlp channel went from 0 → 1 subscriber. Same pattern applies to all long-running subscribers (shell_subscriber also has KeepAlive: true).

pattern: Execute Directly Instead of Fake Delegation
example: 18MB synced to GD. LaunchAgent: com.02luka.sync.gdrive.4h running. Script: backup_to_gdrive.zsh with conflict resolution. No more waiting for systems that don't exist.

Defines runtime validation for com.02luka.* LaunchAgents using launchctl PID/exit status, Redis subscriber counts, and OK/WARN/ERROR classification, with reports stored under reports/system/launchagents_runtime.
